name: Computing UI & Interaction
description: Sector template for UI patents including displays, I/O, gaming, and human-computer interaction.
contextDescription: Computing UI patents cover human-computer interaction and display technologies. Key areas include display processing (G06F3/14*), input methods (G06F3/01*, G06F3/04*), graphics/gaming (A63F13/*), and UI frameworks. Targets include consumer electronics (Apple, Samsung), gaming (Sony, Microsoft, Nintendo), and software platforms (iOS, Android, Windows).
scoringGuidance: Touch/gesture patents read on billions of mobile devices annually.
Display rendering patents apply to all screens with graphical output.
Gaming input/output patents target high-margin gaming consoles and platforms.
Consider VR/AR headset interfaces as emerging high-value targets.
Cross-platform UI patents have broader infringement scope.

questions.question: Does this patent address input methods (touch, gesture, voice, controller)? Score based on ubiquity.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Touch and gesture inputs are universal. Identify the input modality.

questions.question: Does this patent relate to display rendering, graphics processing, or visual output?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Display patents can read on all devices with screens.

questions.question: How applicable is this patent to smartphones and tablets? The highest-volume consumer electronics.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Mobile devices ship billions of units. Assess mobile applicability.

questions.question: Does this patent apply to gaming or XR (VR/AR/MR) systems? High-margin markets.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Gaming and XR are growth markets. Assess applicability.
